intro: Hieracium sublubricicaule, commonly known as the glossy hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy, often reddish stems and basal leaves that are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are yellow, arranged in a flat-topped cluster, and bloom from late spring to early autumn. Hieracium sublubricicaule is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and disturbed soils, and it is known for its ability to thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
